title: Coronation Street and Emmerdale star Hayley Tamaddon gives birth to baby boy
text:
Former Coronation Street and Emmerdale star Hayley Tamaddon has given birth to a baby boy and shared the lovely news on social media, with a picture of the newborn’s hand in hers. The actress, who played Andrea Beckett, the girlfriend of Lloyd Mullaney, on the cobbles has shared her pregnancy journey with Brooke Vincent and Julia Goulding.

The three cobbles actresses have regularly taken pictures together with their bumps and Hayley has marvelled at how big she had become by joking on Instagram that it looked like she had stuffed a watermelon down her pants.

The star recently hit out at trolls who shamed her for sharing pictures of her bump with her followers, with one telling her to ‘put it away’. Hayley won support from her fans by calling out this behaviour.

Also known as Delilah Dingle in Emmerdale and for a stint on Dancing On Ice, Hayley remains close to the Corrie cast and, upon sharing the news, has had waves of congratulatory messages.

She hasn’t yet revealed a name for the new addition to the family. The 42-year-old star has previously described her pregnancy as a ‘miracle’ after being told for years that she wouldn’t be able to conceive.

She welcomes the child with her boyfriend Adrian and she tweeted: ‘He’s here. He’s incredible. And we are besotted.’

Not long ago, Hayley’s followers and friends were shocked that the then seven month pregnant mum-to-be was forced to sit on the floor of a train as others barged past her to get a seat. She said at the time in a tweet to Virgin Trains: ‘Hey @VirginTrains had quite the rotten journey home to manc today as my 1pm was cancelled from Euston.

‘At 7 months pregnant I sat outside the toilet for the whole journey. Staff were amazing by the way but as I had a 1st class ticket I’d like my money back. How do I do this?’ (sic)

Hayley’s newborn son is her first child – what lovely news to start the week with!
